channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton hits out at F1 as drivers are rushed through taking the knee before Hungarian GP
item.description: In a confusing display, Lewis Hamilton and others went down on one knee but other drivers hadn't yet made it to their positions, and could be seen running into place during the moment.

item.title: 'He can't put two sentences together!' Donald Trump claims Joe Biden is 'not competent'
item.description: Donald Trump went on the attack against Joe Biden Sunday, calling into question the presumed Democratic nominee's mental state and bragging about the results of his own cognitive test.

item.title: Nick Cannon hints that he's experienced suicidal thoughts after friend took his own life
item.description: Cannon took to Instagram on Saturday night to pay tribute to his friend Ryan Bowers, an up-and-coming rapper who was signed to the comedian's music label before he died by apparent suicide hours earlier.

item.title: Hundreds of anti-mask activists march on London's Hyde Park wearing plague doctor costumes
item.description: Demonstrators raised signs reading 'I will be not be masked, tested, tracked' and 'no mask' as they gathered in Hyde Park, central London, from 1pm.

item.title: NHS confirms nine more coronavirus deaths in Britain's hospitals
item.description: NHS England announced that eight people aged between 61 and 91 died in hospital after testing positive for Covid-19. Wales reported one new death and Scotland reported none.

item.title: Surge in coronavirus cases as 260,000 people test positive in a day
item.description: The most significant increases were noted in the US, Brazil, India and South Africa, as the total number of confirmed Covid-19 cases surpassed 14 million.

item.title: Heartbreaking moment giant sperm whale is caught in a fishing net
item.description: Boaters on Saturday had spotted the struggling sperm whale in a stretch of the Tyrrhenian Sea off Italy's west coast and contacted the coast guard.

item.title: US coronavirus deaths surpass 140,000 as outbreak worsens in Florida
item.description: US deaths from the novel coronavirus topped 140,000 on Saturday as cases continued to rise in 42 out of 50 states over the past two weeks, according to a Reuters tally.

item.title: Couple married more than 60 years emerge from hospital after beating coronavirus together
item.description: A couple who have been married for more than 60 years emerged from Leicester Royal Infirmary together on Friday after they both spent three weeks there to beat coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak at Scottish Covid-19 test and trace call centre 'leaves seven people ill'
item.description: Measures have been brought in by North Lanarkshire's health board to try and suppress the outbreak. One employee said they believed at least seven colleagues had tested positive.

item.title: Onlookers battle in vain to rescue van being swamped by rising tide after driver parked it on beach
item.description: A white van became stuck in the ocean on Redcar beach in Teeside on Sunday afternoon. The coastguard spent hours trying to free the vehicle as the tide came in and surrounded the car.

item.title: British feminists including Cherie Blair and Jess Phillips rally behind Amber Heard
item.description: Cherie Blair, the barrister and wife of former Prime Minister Tony Blair, is understood to have spoken with the actress' legal team last week.

item.title: Miracle baby girl born 13 weeks early weighing just 1lb 16oz returns home
item.description: Abbey Gardiner, 22, from Porth, South Wales, found out she had pre-eclampsia at 24 weeks and two weeks later gave birth to Forrest at 26 weeks. The baby was born without fingernails and eyes fused.

item.title: 70 trailblazing years of Princess Anne
item.description: Fearless, funny and so hard-working - we salute you PRINCESS ANNE! As she celebrates her 70th birthday

item.title: Buckingham palace shares TWO new photos of Princess Beatrice and Edoardo from their special day
item.description: Princess Beatrice, 31, and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi tied the knot in a ceremony on Friday, and on Sunday, Buckingham Palace shared two new pictures of the happy couple on Instagram.

item.title: Doting father of 14-week-old 'miracle baby' dies after his canoe overturned on lake
item.description: Mark Hill, 40, the father of a 14-week-old 'miracle baby' died on Saturday after his body was pulled from a lake in Wigan, Greater Manchester following a canoe incident. His family is distraught.

item.title: Trump says Confederate flag proud symbol of U.S. South
item.description: President Donald Trump refused to say the Confederate flag is an offensive symbol during an interview on Fox News Sunday saying 'it represents the South'.

item.title: Track-and-trace fail to reach HALF of people in close contact with Covid-19 patients in Blackburn
item.description: Professor Dominic Harrison - public health director of Blackburn with Darwen Council - revealed the figures and warned of 'exponential growth' of new infections if the system did not become more efficient.

item.title: Chinese social media giant TikTok scraps plan to build global HQ in Britain
item.description: TikTok had been in discussions with the Department for International Trade and No 10 to establish a worldwide base in London.

item.title: Kanye West to hold first campaign rally in South Carolina as he pushes unlikely presidential bid
item.description: Amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak, all attendees will be required to wear masks and sign a COVID-19 liability release form.

item.title: White Island volcano survivor shares details about her recovery and most painful part of ordeal
item.description: White Island volcano survivor Stephanie Browitt has shared harrowing details about her long road to recovery and the frustration around having to learn to walk again

item.title: Trump says he'll be 'right eventually' after predicting that coronavirus will just 'disappear'
item.description: Donald Trump asserted Sunday morning that he will 'eventually' get it right on coronavirus after he claimed on several occasions that the threat will just 'disappear' one day.

item.title: Pictured: Teenager, 19, stabbed to death in locked-down Leicester
item.description: Hassan Jama (left) was found with fatal stab wounds in the Highfields area of Leicester on Saturday morning. An 18-year-old man remains in custody and cordons are still in place.

item.title: PICTURE EXCLUSIVE: David and Victoria Beckham FINALLY jet off on a post-lockdown trip with the kids
item.description: The Beckhams have finally regained a semblance of their usual jet-set lifestyle by flying off to Puglia in Italy.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson puts on a VERY animated display reading Dinky Donkey
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, read The Dinky Donkey by Craig Smith for today's edition of Story Time with Fergie and Friends. She shared the video two days after Beatrice's wedding.

item.title: Girl, three, dies after being knocked down by car right outside her house in Warwickshire
item.description: A three-year-old girl has died after being knocked down by a car outside her home in Warwickshire on Friday. The child was hit by a black Skoda Citigo at around 5.45pm. One woman has been arrested.

item.title: Second-hand taffata gown with bodice encrusted with diamante was huge message of support from Queen
item.description: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN: Fashion is so often used to make a statement and this gown, personally loaned by the Queen, sends a huge message of her support to a much-loved granddaughter.

item.title: Man is arrested after staff member was stabbed inside Royal Sussex hospital
item.description: Joseph George, 56, was knifed on the 11th floor gynaecology ward of the Royal Sussex County Hospital in Brighton at around 8.40am. A man has been arrested for attempted murder.

item.title: Harry Dunn's mother urges Boris Johnson to make her son's death his 'top priority'
item.description: Dominic Raab told Sky News's Sophy Ridge that while there had been a 'denial of justice' in the case of Harry Dunn, there were 'no measures' the UK could realistically take to extradite Anne Sacoolas.

item.title: Mini-heatwave comes to an abrupt end as torrential rain soaks the South and UK temperatures plummet
item.description: Heavy clouds and outbreaks of rain will make their way across southern England and East Anglia today as temperatures begin to drop to around 72-73F (22-23C)

item.title: Bride's bizarre engagement ring is slammed by social media users
item.description: An anonymous woman, from Texas, has taken to Facebook group That's It, I'm Ring Shaming, and shared two snaps of a bride-to-be's controversial engagement ring

item.title: Fitness fanatic, 27, dies at home after drinking alcohol on an empty stomach triggers rare reaction
item.description: Alice Burton Bradford, 27, from Brighton suffered from alcoholic ketoacidosis - a metabolic complication which can be triggered from drinking on an empty stomach. She died in her garden on June 1.

item.title: Police catch two teenage boys riding rented 11mph e-scooters along dual carriageway
item.description: The two teenage boys were spotted by Cleveland Police officers at Teesside Retail Park riding their Ginger Hire E-Scooters along the busy A19 near Middlesborough on July 16.

item.title: Dambusters hero's niece is branded racist
item.description: Sarah Hobday, 41, launched a campaign to return black Labrador N****r's name to the headstone at RAF Scampton, Lincolnshire amid fury over its removal.

item.title: Ten emergency 'Nightingale courts' are set up to help justice system tackle backlog of cases
item.description: Magistrates' courts in England and Wales are facing a backlog of 480,000 cases. Almost half of all courts were closed in March to minimise social interaction between court users.

item.title: Chinese ambassador insists Uighur Muslims live in 'peace and harmony'
item.description: Liu Xiaoming today denied reports that China is carrying out a programme of sterilisation of Uighur women in the Xinjiang region.

item.title: Tyrese Haspil - personal assistant accused of murdering his tech CEO boss - had 'troubled childhood'
item.description: Tyrese Haspil, 21, was arrested on Friday and charged with the grisly murder of his boss Fahim Saleh. Haspil's aunt Marjorie Sine expressed her shock over the allegations against him.

item.title: Woman pregnant with twins in intensive care on ventilator with COVID-19 as death toll is set to soar
item.description: Kaillee Dyke is 27 weeks pregnant with twins and on a ventilator in the intensive care unit at Royal Melbourne Hospital after she contracted coronavirus.

item.title: Over 3,000 lockdown revellers flock to illegal rave near Bath
item.description: People broke social distancing rules as they gathered to dance, drink and blast music at the former Charmy Down airfield, in Upper Swainswick, three miles from the city of Bath.

item.title: 'Brave and talented' police dog Poppy is given the Speaker's chair during security sweep of Commons
item.description: Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle met Poppy the explosives dog while doing a regular security sweep of Commons, who was given a 'canine OBE' for her work in the 2017 terror attack on Borough Market.

item.title: Terrifying footage shows dozens of uniformed gunmen of the Jalisco drug cartel in Mexico
item.description: Terrifying footage shows dozens of uniformed gunmen posing with military-grade weapons near armored pickup trucks emblazoned with the initials of the Jalisco drug cartel in Mexico.

item.title: Personal trainer shares the three different body types - and the diet and exercise to follow
item.description: A personal trainer has revealed the three different body types - and the best workout tips and diet tricks for each type of physique. Rachael Attard, from Sydney, said you need to eat and work out right.

item.title: Kate Garraway thanks Myleene Klass and Roman Kemp for helping with son Billy's 11th birthday bash
item.description: Taking to Instagram late on Saturday night, the GMB host, 53, shared a series of videos and photographs along with lengthy captions to express her gratitude

item.title: Balmoral rangers slams wild campers after abandoned tents left strewn across Queen's Scottish estate
item.description: Balmoral rangers criticised wild campers on Twitter after a group seemingly abandoned tents, rubbish and plastic bags on the Queen's Scottish estate on Saturday.

item.title: Tragedy as 14-month-old girl dies after being hit by a reversing car her family's driveway
item.description: A 14-month-old girl has died after being run over by a car reversing on a driveway at a family home southwest of Ipswich on Sunday.

item.title: County lines kingpin caught him throwing crack cocaine worth £8,000 down the toilet in police raid
item.description: Drug Dealer Melvin Gambanga, 23, was arrested at his home in Gravesend, Kent. Officers smashed down his front door and then pulled a plastic bag of drugs out of his toilet.

item.title: Nine UK universities that rely on Chinese students for a FIFTH of their income
item.description: Ministers have braced themselves for a reduction in the 120,000 Chinese students in the UK tensions rise with Beijing. The University of Glasgow relies on Chinese students 31% of its tuition income.

item.title: Armed police swoop after man, 40, is hacked in the neck with 'machete'
item.description: The man, in his 40s, suffered injuries to his neck and legs in Prescot, Merseyside in what police believe was a targeted attack.

item.title: Beatrice poses with new husband Edoardo and her grandparents after socially distanced wedding
item.description: Princess Beatrice married on Friday wearing both a tiara and vintage dress generously lent to her by her grandmother, deeply conscious that the 31-year-old was missing out on a traditional large wedding.

item.title: China accuses the UK of 'dancing to America's tune' over Huawei decision
item.description: Liu Xiaoming, China's ambassador to the UK, said excluding the Chinese tech giant from the infrastructure represented a 'dark day' for Britain.

item.title: Thorpe Park remains open despite attempted murder on site
item.description: Thorpe Park in Surrey today announced it felt 'confident' that it had the 'necessary security procedures' in place to keep its guests and staff safe and would remain remain open to the public.

item.title: Photographer behind Beatrice's wedding snaps says the event was 'a milestone' of his career
item.description: London-based photographer Benjamin Wheeler, who captured Princess Beatrice's big day in Windsor, has taken to Instagram to reveal the event was a 'milestone' in his career.

item.title: Grace Kelly's granddaughter Camille Gottlieb reveals she's recently single
item.description: Camille Gotlieb, 22, the daughter of Stephanie of Monaco and who is Grace Kelly's granddaughter, revealed on Instagram she's recently single and would rather be alone than in bad company.

item.title: London work's running dry: Scramble for jobs as 484 people apply for TWO vacancies at pub
item.description: As many as 484 hopefuls applied for two £9-an-hour positions at the Alexandra pub in Wimbledon, southwest London (pictured).

item.title: Russia report claims Moscow meddled in Scottish independence vote
item.description: The report set to be published this week could reignite fears that Russia intervened in the 2016 Brexit referendum. But some have dubbed it an attempt to 'sabotage' the result.

item.title: Fur-einds reunited! Missing cat Gizmo is returned home to its owner six YEARS after vanishing
item.description: Zoe Foster, from Hucknall, Nottinghamshire, was reunited with her tabby cat Gizmo, who vanished six years ago. The mother-of-two thought it was a prank call when the vet said he was found on Monday.

item.title: Cold sore sufferer, 37, praises £8.50 liquorice balm for clearing up her symptoms in DAYS
item.description: Nicola Freeman, 37, from Hampshire, developed her first cold sore aged 16 - and says at her worst, she would have six at the same time, causing her lips to swell.

item.title: Dominic Raab plays down 'split' between Boris Johnson and Sir Patrick Vallance
item.description: Dominic Raab today tried to pour cold water on growing claims of a split between Boris Johnson and his top scientist Sir Patrick Vallance.

item.title: Mother-of-one transforms her downstairs loo into a chic space for just £250
item.description: Becky Sack, 27, a self-employed nail technician from Kettering, pulled off her affordable loo transformation after deciding that the small room didn't fit with the rest of the house.

item.title: Savvy shopper reveals she bagged £35 of products for £3 using an anti-food waste app
item.description: Laura Williams, 30, from the West Midlands, revealed her secret was to buy a Morrison's 'Magic Box' reduced to £3.09 on the Too Good To Go app, a platform designed to combat food waste.

item.title: Flexible three-day-week season tickets aim to get commuters back into London offices
item.description: Great Western Railway is proposing a 'three days in seven' season tickets for commuters travelling into London. Another flexible ticket option will also permit travel on any 12 days of the month.

item.title: COVID-19 Victoria: Mandatory mask order sparks panic-buying in Melbourne
item.description: From Thursday, any Victorian from locked down suburbs across Melbourne and the Mitchell Shire caught without a mask in public will face a $200 on the spot fine.

item.title: Animal lovers share hilarious photos of their beloved pets looking very ugly
item.description: Twitter users from all over the world have shared very ugly pictures of their beloved pets in a hilarious Twitter thread. From unfortunately angles to bad timing, these definitely won't make it to Instagram.

item.title: Prince Harry thanks author who sent him a book aimed at dealing with losing a parent
item.description: UK-based writer Mark Lemon wrote 'The Magical Wood' after his father was murdered 28 years ago. He sent a copy to Prince Harry after admiring how he'd coped with the death of his own mother.

item.title: National Lottery lets children gamble £350 a week online
item.description: In the UK the minimum age for gambling in the UK is 18, which leave Camelot, the body behind the National Lottery, with exclusive access to the teenage gambling market.

item.title: Portuguese police mugshots of Christian Brueckner from 1999 reveal officers knew about sordid past
item.description: The series of pictures were taken in the Algarve in July 1999 - eight years before the youngster was abducted from Praia da Luz.

item.title: Experts warn owners that face coverings leave canines feeling 'confused and concerned'
item.description: Animal charity Dogs Trust has warned that people suddenly wearing face masks could scare dogs, as they cannot read facial expressions. The charity urged owners to be careful on public transport.

item.title: Queen Letizia and King Felipe VI of Spain look relaxed in casual outfits as they head to the cinema
item.description: Queen Letizia, 47, and King Felipe of Spain, 52, headed to the cinema in Madrid on Saturday for a casual date night. The royals left their two daughters, Leonor, 14 and Sofia, 13, at home.

item.title: Man shares photos of 'creepy' triggerfish that has full lips and a set of human-like TEETH
item.description: Experts say the weird-looking fish, found in Malaysia, could be a Blackpatch triggerfish which has such enormous gnashers for snacking on prickly sea urchins and crabs.

item.title: Health Secretary Matt Hancock will hand over names and testing data of Covid patients to councils
item.description: Local authorities are said to have been calling for full access to 'named patient data' in order to properly tackle local outbreaks. Matt Hancock will announce authorities will be able to see the data.

item.title: Self-employed hairdresser wins right to claim notice, holiday and redundancy pay in 'landmark' case
item.description: Meghan Gorman, 26, won an Employment Tribunal judgement arguing that the level of control she had over her working practices at a Manchester Terence Paul salon effectively made her an employee.

item.title: Sexist body terms like Adam's apple should no longer be used doctor says
item.description: Queensland specialist obstetrician, gynaecologist and anatomy lecturer, Dr Kristin Small, teaches students to phase out irrelevant and misogynistic medical language.

item.title: Best-selling Christian author Matthew Paul Turner is gay and announces he is divorcing his wife
item.description: Christian children's book author Matthew Paul Turner has come out as gay on social media and announced that he and his wife are divorcing, 16 years after they married..

item.title: China warns UK firms 'retaliation is coming' over Huawei 5G ban
item.description: China has warned British businesses 'retaliation is coming' and they could be 'in the firing line' after the UK banned Huawei from the nation's 5G network.

item.title: How good is YOUR general knowledge?
item.description: The online challenge, shared on US-based website Playbuzz, is comprised of a mixture of straightforward questions and logic puzzles that require lateral thinking.

item.title: EDWARD JAY EPSTEIN investigates seemingly unsolvable mystery of how Jeffrey Epstein made his fortune
item.description: EDWARD JAY EPSTEIN: Ghislaine Maxwell may be the last person alive who knows the answers to one of the decade's great mysteries: how did Jeffrey Epstein amass his fortune and where is it now?

item.title: Dozens of patients sue the NHS over claims they suffered brain damage after having therapy
item.description: Dozens of patients who underwent a highly controversial form of treatment for depression are suing the NHS claiming they suffered brain damage.

item.title: Leeds legends unite in fight to save pitches where they first played
item.description: Stars including former England international David Batty forged their fledgling careers playing for Leeds City Boys at the TV Harrison Ground, the proposed site for a development of 61 homes.

item.title: Great British Boltholes: A review of Greenbank Hotel Falmouth, Cornwall
item.description: The Greenbank's perfect waterside location allows guests to jump on and off ferries during their stay, take watersport lessons, or even hire a boat to explore miles of inlets and estuaries.

item.title: Aviation tycoon loses High Court bid to overturn UK lockdown
item.description: Simon Dolan raised more than £200,000 through crowdfunding to launch the claim against Health Secretary Matt Hancock and Education Secretary Gavin Williamson over the lockdown laws.
